page.title: 01General description
page.content: Predominantly a rural area, the farmland consists of small to medium sized fields enclosed mainly by dry stone walls and hedges (few fences). A comprehensive network of foot and bridle paths is still in existence and well-used. Local industries include textiles, now in decline with many of the mill premises lying idle or taken over by small (often service-based) firms, and pipe manufacturers, raw materials for these coming from local clay and shale quarries. Residential areas are expanding quite rapidly with the influx of middle management (in particular) who have easy access to all parts of the UK, but particularly Leeds, Manchester and Sheffield, using the motorway system. Long-standing local families tend to have a strong Methodist tradition and a desire to live and work close to their roots.
